title: Ticket #1442: getDelimitedStringV1RawOrV2Quoted() of Env has a concatenation issue
description:
The getDelimitedStringV1RawOrV2Quoted() function: 
bool
Env::getDelimitedStringV1RawOrV2Quoted(MyString *result,MyString *error_msg) const
{
	if(getDelimitedStringV1Raw(result,NULL)) {
		return true;
	}
	else {
		return getDelimitedStringV2Quoted(result,error_msg);
	}
}

In cases in which getDelimitedStringV1RawOrV2Quoted() cannot return a V1Raw string getDelimitedStringV1Raw() modifies result and returns false. Then getDelimitedStringV2Quoted() concatenates whatever was in result with the expected output.

Here is a case that fails: 

Env env;
MyString actual, error;
env.MergeFromV2Raw("one=1 two=2 three=3 semi=;", NULL);
env.getDelimitedStringV1RawOrV2Quoted(&actual, &error);

actual.Value() returns three=3"three=3 semi=; two=2 one=1" instead of just "three=3 semi=; two=2 one=1".
check_ins: 2010-Jun-10 13:04   Check-in [18444]: Changed getDelimitedStringV1RawOrV2Quoted() so that the result MyString is cleared before calling getDelimitedStringV2Quoted(). #1442 (By Josh Slauson )
creator: slauson
